components.name: NavBar
components.description: Bottom navigation bar on mobile (fixed, above safe-area inset) and top horizontal nav on desktop (md+). Renders four primary destinations: Home (dashboard), Expenses, Settle, Settings. Active tab has an indigo top-border indicator on mobile and an underline on desktop. Notification badge overlays the Expenses icon when there are unread entries.

props.description: Which nav item is currently active

props.name: unreadCount
props.description: Badge count shown on Expenses tab icon; omit or 0 to hide

props.name: householdName
props.description: Shown in top-bar header alongside logo on desktop

components.name: Button
components.description: Multi-variant action button with minimum 44px touch target. All variants use slightly irregular border-radius for hand-drawn feel and a coloured offset shadow. Loading state replaces children with a spinner. Icon slot available on left or right.

props.name: variant
props.description: Visual style preset; defaults to primary

props.name: size
props.description: Controls padding and font size; defaults to md

props.name: loading
props.description: Replaces label with spinner and disables interaction

props.name: disabled
props.description: Mutes colors and blocks pointer events

props.name: icon
props.description: Optional icon rendered before the label

components.name: Input
components.description: Labelled text input with helper text, error state, and prefix/suffix slots. Currency mode prefixes a $ sign and sets numeric keyboard on mobile. Error state adds a red border and shows an inline message below. Minimum height 44px for touch compliance.

props.name: error
props.description: Error message; presence triggers red state

props.name: helper
props.description: Helper text shown below field in normal state

props.name: prefix
props.description: Node rendered inside left edge (e.g. $ sign)

props.name: type
props.description: Input mode; currency shows $ prefix and numeric keyboard

components.name: ExpenseCard
components.description: Displays a single expense row in the expenses list. Left: category emoji icon in a tinted circle. Center: description, CategoryBadge, payer name with avatar, date. Right: total amount bold, current user's share in muted caption. On mobile, swipe-left reveals Edit and Delete action buttons. Recurring expenses show a ğŸ”„ badge.

props.name: category
props.description: Category drives icon and badge color

components.name: AddExpenseDrawer
components.description: Primary expense entry UI. Renders as a bottom-sheet drawer on mobile (slides up from bottom, handle bar at top) and a centered modal on desktop. Amount input is large (48px font) and auto-focused on open. Paid-by and split-among sections show circular member avatars as toggles. Split type tabs switch between Equal/Exact/Percentage/Shares. Category picker is a horizontal scrollable pill row. Save CTA shows computed per-person amount in real time.

props.name: members
props.description: All household members for payer/split selectors

props.name: editExpense
props.description: When provided, drawer is in edit mode

components.name: BalanceSummaryCard
components.description: Shows one member's monthly financial position. Header: avatar + name. Three stat pills: Total Paid, Your Share, Net Balance. Net balance is bold green (positive, owed to them) or bold red (negative, they owe). Used in a 2-column grid on the dashboard and as full-width rows in the settlement screen.

props.name: member
props.description: Member data including name, avatarUrl, color

props.name: totalPaid
props.description: Total cents paid by this member this month

props.name: totalOwed
props.description: Total cents this member owes (their share of all expenses)

props.name: netBalance
props.description: Positive = others owe them, negative = they owe others

props.name: isCurrentUser
props.description: Highlights card with indigo border when true

props.name: compact
props.description: Compact mode for grid layout â€” hides stat labels

components.name: SettlementTransactionRow
components.description: A single debt-simplification transaction. Shows payer avatar+name on left, dashed arrow with bold amount in centre, receiver avatar+name on right. Below: row of payment deep-link buttons (Venmo blue, PayPal navy, Zelle purple). A checkbox on the far left marks it as settled â€” on check, the row fades and gets a strikethrough with a green Settled badge.

components.name: Toast

userFlows.name: Authentication
userFlows.description: Complete sign-up and login flow from landing page to first dashboard view. Supports magic-link email and Google OAuth. Roommates joining via invite link bypass the create-household step.

steps.action: User visits app URL; sees RoomieTab logo, tagline, and sign-in form
User enters email and taps 'Send Magic Link' or clicks 'Continue with Google'
Toast shows 'Check your email' â€” user opens their email client
User clicks magic link in email; browser opens with auth token in URL
New user chooses 'Create a household' or 'Join with invite link'
User names household, sets own display name, invites roommates
User lands on dashboard with empty state and a 'Add your first expense' prompt
Returning user enters email, receives link, clicks link

userFlows.name: Add Expense
userFlows.description: Fast expense capture from any screen in under 10 seconds. FAB opens the AddExpenseDrawer; amount field is auto-focused. Optimistic UI means the expense appears instantly in the list before the server round-trip completes.

steps.action: User taps the indigo Floating Action Button (+ icon)
Amount field is auto-focused; user types expense total (e.g. 84.20)
User types a short description (e.g. 'Whole Foods run')
User taps payer avatar (defaults to self) â€” can change to another member
User reviews split-among avatars (defaults to all); taps to deselect any member
Optionally changes split type from Equal to Exact/Percentage/Shares
Optionally taps a category pill (e.g. Groceries)
Taps 'Save Expense â€” $84.20'; drawer closes, optimistic entry appears in list
Success toast 'Grocery run added!' appears with Undo option; balances update live
If amount is missing or split doesn't add up, inline error shows and save is blocked

userFlows.name: Month-End Settlement
userFlows.description: Hero workflow showing minimum-transaction debt simplification. User reviews who owes whom, uses one-tap payment links, marks transactions settled, then archives the month.

steps.action: User taps 'Settle' in bottom nav or 'Settle Up' CTA on dashboard
User sees hero banner: '3 transactions clear all debts â€” algorithm optimized'
User reviews per-member summary table (paid / share / net for each roommate)
User reads first minimum transaction row: 'Jordan pays Maya $24.50'
Jordan taps Venmo button; Venmo app opens pre-filled with Maya's handle and $24.50
Jordan completes payment in Venmo and returns to RoomieTab
Jordan taps checkbox on that transaction row; row fades with strikethrough and 'Settled' badge
User repeats for remaining transactions until all are marked settled
User taps 'Archive February & Start March'; confirmation modal appears
User confirms archival; month is saved to history, new month begins
Optionally taps Export PDF or Export CSV before archiving

userFlows.name: Household Setup
userFlows.description: Onboarding flow for the household admin to create a group and invite up to 4 roommates. Roommates can join as guests via link with no account required.

steps.action: New authenticated user taps 'Create a household'
User types household name (e.g. 'Maple House ğŸ')
User types their own display name
User types roommate emails one by one; each added as a pending member row
User copies the shareable invite link to send via iMessage/WhatsApp
User taps 'Create Household â†’'; server creates group, invites sent
Roommate opens invite link; sees household name and a 'Join as Guest' / 'Sign up' option
Roommate enters display name and taps Join (no account needed for guest mode)

userFlows.name: Settings and Profile
userFlows.description: User manages their profile, household, notification preferences, recurring expenses, and data export from a single Settings screen.

steps.action: User taps Settings in bottom nav
User edits display name inline or taps avatar to change photo
User views members, copies invite link, or taps Rename household
User toggles push notification preferences for new expenses, tags, reminders
User taps a recurring expense row to edit amount, day, or members
User updates expense details and saves
User taps Export PDF or Export CSV; file is generated and download begins
User taps Sign Out; session cleared, redirected to Login
User taps Delete Account; confirmation modal warns of permanent data loss

guidelines: All primary interactive elements (buttons, inputs, links) meet WCAG 2.1 AA contrast ratio of 4.5:1 for normal text
Minimum touch target size of 44Ã—44px enforced on all interactive elements per WCAG 2.5.5 (AAA target)
Focus-visible ring (3px indigo-200) applied to all keyboard-focusable elements; never remove outline without replacement
Font sizes: body text minimum 15px (0.9375rem), captions minimum 12px used only for non-critical supplementary info
The 12px caption size is used exclusively for secondary data (share amounts, dates) â€” never for primary actions or required labels
Error states use both color (red border) AND an icon (âš ) AND text message â€” never color alone (WCAG 1.4.1)
Category badges use both color AND an emoji/icon to distinguish categories â€” not color alone
Positive/negative balance indicators use color AND a +/â€“ prefix â€” not color alone
Settlement transaction 'settled' state uses both a strikethrough AND a text badge AND reduced opacity
All images and avatar fallbacks have meaningful alt text or aria-label; decorative emojis use aria-hidden='true'
AddExpenseDrawer uses role='dialog' with aria-modal='true' and aria-labelledby pointing to 'Add Expense' heading
Toast notifications use role='status' (success/info) or role='alert' (error/warning) for screen-reader announcement
NavBar items use aria-current='page' on active tab for screen readers
Amount input in AddExpenseDrawer has inputmode='decimal' for optimized mobile numeric keyboard
All toggle switches use role='switch' with aria-checked state
Color palette tested at 3 deuteranopia simulation â€” indigo/teal/amber combination remains distinguishable
Dark mode tokens maintain minimum 4.5:1 contrast: white (#fff) on gray-700 (#374151) = 8.3:1, gray-300 on gray-900 = 9.1:1
Reduced-motion: all animations (toast slide, FAB pulse, drawer transition) respect prefers-reduced-motion media query

mockups.description: Main home screen showing hero balance card (my balance +$24.50), 4-member balance grid, donut breakdown chart with category legend, 3 recent expense cards, and a settlement CTA banner. FAB and bottom nav included. Hand-sketched aesthetic with soft blue/teal/lavender palette and Caveat font labels.

AddExpenseDrawer rendered as a bottom-sheet overlay. Shows large auto-focused amount input ($84.20), description field, paid-by member avatar row with Maya selected, split-among row with all 4 avatars and per-person amounts ($21.05 each), split type tabs (Equal active), category pill grid (Groceries active), and full-width Save CTA. Background page blurred behind overlay.

Month-end settlement screen with algorithm hero banner ('3 transactions clear all debts'), per-member summary table (paid / share / net), 3 minimum-transaction rows with payerâ†’receiver arrows and Venmo/PayPal/Zelle payment buttons. Third row shown in settled state with strikethrough. Archive and Export buttons at bottom.

Full expense ledger for February 2025. Sticky header with search input and month navigator. Category filter chips (All active). Stats bar showing $1,148 total / 14 expenses / $287.50 your share. Expenses grouped by date (Feb 18, Feb 15, Feb 1) with dashed dividers. CategoryBadges and payer avatars on each card. Recurring badge on Netflix and Rent.

Centered login card on a gradient background with decorative emoji. Magic-link email input with 'Send Magic Link' primary CTA and Google OAuth secondary button. 'Use invite link instead' helper link. Success toast 'Check your email' shown at top. Clean, minimal, trust-signaling design.

3-step onboarding card: household name input (Maple House ğŸ), display name input, member list with Jordan and Priya shown as pending invites, an add-member email slot, and a copyable shareable invite link box. Step-dot progress indicator at top. Create Household CTA at bottom.

Scrollable settings page with 5 grouped sections: Profile (avatar + editable name), Household (members, invite link), Notifications (4 toggles: 3 on / 1 off), Recurring Expenses (Rent + Netflix rows), Data & Export (PDF/CSV buttons). Sign Out full-width button at bottom. Bottom nav with Settings tab active.
